originalTitle: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
title: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
content: Kizza Besigye’s party says his condition is critical, but authorities say he was taken to hospital for a routine check-up.

originalTitle: Nigeria police confirm mass church abductions after previous denial
title: Nigeria police confirm mass church abductions after previous denial
content: More than 160 people were reportedly taken from three churches in the northern Kaduna state.

title: Ex-president accused of murder plot expelled from Togo to Burkina Faso
content: Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba has not commented on the accusations from Burkina Faso.

content: Artillery fire, gunship attack, demolitions in war-battered Gaza as PM Netanyahu accepts US 'peace board' position.

originalTitle: Japan to restart world’s biggest nuclear plant after 15-year shutdown
title: Japan to restart world’s biggest nuclear plant after 15-year shutdown
content: Petition signed by 40,000 relays concerns over risk of seismic activity in vicinity of Kashiwazaki-Kariwa plant.

title: Syrian government and SDF agree on four-day ceasefire
content: The Syrian government has announced a four-day ceasefire with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces.

title: Lyse Doucet: Trump is shaking the world order more than any president since WW2
content: Trump's demands over Greenland are a rude awakening in a moment fraught with risk.

originalTitle: Train driver killed in second deadly Spain rail crash in days
title: Train driver killed in second deadly Spain rail crash in days
content: At least 37 people have been injured, five seriously, in a second crash, after Sunday's two-train collision in Andalusia.

title: Locked exits, panic and desperate calls for help: Survivors tell of mall fire horror
content: The BBC speaks to eyewitnesses and survivors of the fire that ripped through a busy Pakistan shopping centre.

title: 'Battered in Bodo' - is this more than just a blip for Man City?
content: Manchester City suffered their very own "hell of a beating" moment in Norway on Tuesday - now Pep Guardiola and his players must turn around their fortunes in an increasingly trying January.

title: 'Good signs' or just buying time? Spurs remain divided on Frank future
content: Many Tottenham fans have already lost faith in Thomas Frank - but did Tuesday's 2-0 win over Borussia Dortmund give cause for optimism?
